Package com.blogger.blogs.controllers

Class PostController

java.lang.Object
com.blogger.blogs.controllers.PostController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/posts", produces="application/json") public class PostController extends Object
This class provides REST APIs associated with operations on Post.

  • Method Details

    • getPosts

      @GetMapping org.springframework.data.domain.Page<com.blogger.blogs.dto.PostInfo> getPosts(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      The API fetches the paginated list of all Blog Posts. The system excludes posts authored by blocked users. User information has to be passed as a valid JWT Token in header.
      Parameters:
      pageable - Paging information
      authentication - current user information to be passed a JWT token in header
      Returns:
      A paginated list of all posts

    • createPost

      @PostMapping @ResponseStatus(CREATED) com.blogger.blogs.dto.PostDetails createPost(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid com.blogger.blogs.dto.CreatePostRequest createPostRequest, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      API used to create a new blog post with given details.A Valid authentication is required. User information has to be passed as a valid JWT Token in header.
      Parameters:
      createPostRequest - The details for the post to be created.
      authentication - current user information to be passed a JWT token in header
      Returns:
      PostDetails - the details of created post including id.

    • getPostDetails

      @GetMapping("{id}") com.blogger.blogs.dto.PostDetails getPostDetails(@PathVariable("id") Long id, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      API to fetch the details of a post with given id. User information has to be passed as a valid JWT Token in header.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of post for which details has to be fetched.
      authentication - current user information to be passed a JWT token in header
      Returns:
      PostDetails
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.client.HttpClientErrorException.Forbidden - if the requested post is authored by a blocked user.

    • deletePost

      @DeleteMapping("{id}") @ResponseStatus(OK) void deletePost(@PathVariable("id") Long id, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      API to delete a post with a given id. Only owners can delete a post. User information has to be passed as a valid JWT Token in header.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the post to be deleted.
      authentication - current user information to be passed a JWT token in header

    • updatePost

      @PutMapping @ResponseStatus(OK) com.blogger.blogs.dto.PostDetails updatePost(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid com.blogger.blogs.dto.UpdatePostRequest updatePostRequest, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      API to edit a post with a given id. Only owners can edit a post. User information has to be passed as a valid JWT Token in header.
      Parameters:
      updatePostRequest - A json with the updated information about the post.
      authentication - current user information to be passed a JWT token in header
      Returns:
      PostDetails- details of the updated post.
